comments:
OS:		<AIX 5.2> 
Language:	<Japanese locale:Ja_JP.IBM-943>
Build level: 	<3.0-aix-motif(20040422)>
JDK version:  IBM JDK 1.4.2 Beta  

Summary: DBCS: Http Proxy Recorder does not start correctly. 


Steps to recreate problem:
1- confirm RAServer is configured and invoked.
1- Window->Preference->Test->Http Proxy Recorder,
   then select "None" as "Application to record". Click Apply and OK.
2- Create Simple Project.
3- File->New->Other->Test->Recording->HTTP Proxy Recorder, then click Next.
4- enter "test.rec" as Recording file name, and click Finish. 

Error: 
 Http Proxy Recorder could connect to RAServer correctly, however, stopped at a 
stage of "Setting up Java environment on localhost". At that time, 
java.lang.UnsatisfiedLinkError was logged in .log file. This problem does not 
occur on windows build. 

Expected Result: 
 No error message is logged and HTTP Proxy Recoreder starts correctly.

Created an attachment (id=9948)
stdout 

sorry, error message is not logged in .log file, but outputted to stdout. I
saved this message and attach here.

The attached error log shows an error in 
org.eclipse.hyades.internal.execution.remote.  I believe this is the harness.

Here is the message:  

====>java.lang.UnsatisfiedLinkError: sendMessageBinary0
        at 
org.eclipse.hyades.internal.execution.remote.RemoteComponentSkeleton.sendMessage
ToAttachedClient(RemoteComponentSkeleton.java:461)
====>   at 
org.eclipse.hyades.internal.execution.remote.RemoteComponentSkeleton.broadcastMe
ssage(RemoteComponentSkeleton.java:667)
        at org.eclipse.hyades.execution.remote.SessionImpl.replyRemote
(SessionImpl.java:160)
        at org.eclipse.hyades.execution.remote.SessionImpl.handleCommands
(SessionImpl.java:206)
        at org.eclipse.hyades.execution.remote.NodeImpl.main(NodeImpl.java:42)

Content-Type: text/plain

====>java.lang.UnsatisfiedLinkError: sendMessageBinary0
        at 
org.eclipse.hyades.internal.execution.remote.RemoteComponentSkeleton.sendMessage
ToAttachedClient(RemoteComponentSkeleton.java:461)
====>   at 
org.eclipse.hyades.internal.execution.remote.RemoteComponentSkeleton.broadcastMe
ssage(RemoteComponentSkeleton.java:667)
        at org.eclipse.hyades.execution.remote.SessionImpl.replyRemote
(SessionImpl.java:160)
        at org.eclipse.hyades.execution.remote.SessionImpl.handleCommands
(SessionImpl.java:206)
        at org.eclipse.hyades.execution.remote.NodeImpl.main(NodeImpl.java:42)

This seems lika a RAC issue on AIX.  The error is an unsatisfied link error 
looking for native code, sendMessageBinary0().  This native method was added 
recently, and perhaps doesn't appear properly on AIX.

Changed component and owner.

Bob,

i believe you added this code.  The issue with AIX is you must explicitly name 
each and every exported function in a shared object in a export file.  Please 
make sure this entry is added to the export file.  If you are tight for time 
please delegate this Samson.  Its a 2 minute fix.

Richard, 

That's not part of what I was doing. I checked with Dave and it's part of what 
he did a few weeks ago.  He's agreed to take it.

Fix was to add the new native sendMessageBinary0 method name to the AIX 
libhcjbnd.so export file hcjbnd.exp.

I verified this fix on I20040506 build. 
I close this bug. Thanks!
